Edited June 27, 2016 by igor290506

Given the lack of expanded information from the OP here, I'm going to assume that Speeding Mullet's suggestion was ignored and the link left un-clicked.  Thus, allow me to re-iterate the point, in part, without requiring you to click anything.

Is this challenge new?

This question gets a pass.  I haven't spotted anybody requesting that everybody try this specific task, so that's a go.  (If anybody else knows of a pre-existing version, do feel free to pipe in!)

Is this challenge possible?

No evidence that @igor290506 has even attempted what is being suggested.  Give us some screen-shots of your try at this, instead of just thinking "Hey, this would be cool" and throwing it out there.

Is this challenge fun?

I've personally gone to Duna and back on only Sparks and Twitches for the sake of a challenge, so I'm not one to judge anybody here on what they decide is or isn't fun.  

What are we trying to do?

Less than 2 lines of text, unformatted and unpunctuated, leave me little idea of exactly what's in the OP's mind.  I want to be excited about a challenge that makes me feel like something is, in some manner, the most Kerbal thing I've ever tried.  That's difficult when the person proposing the mission is putting in the absolute minimum effort to communicate with me what it is he wants to see me try.

How do we win this anyway?

Landing on the Mun with a three-part craft might be possible.  The three parts specified?  I'm not entirely certain, but I won't rule it out (somebody would certainly strive to prove me wrong if I called it impossible.  It's in our nature as players.)  If it can be pulled off, then how are we scoring this?  Most fuel left over on landing?  Shortest mission time at touchdown?  Is it just a "Hey, you did this, have your imaginary badge!" sort of deal?

 

@Speeding Mullet, and everybody asking questions, is trying to help you make this a challenge to last the ages-- or at least one that will attract a page or two worth of entries before it fades away.  As it stands, it's not there yet.  Meet us partway, here, and we might be able to craft something awe-inspiring.

if chalange completed score is 100000

4 minutes ago, igor290506 said:

if chalange completed score is 100000

i will recommend using s3 ks-25 cvector engine and heatseald

You've missed the point that I was making.  A random number thrown out is of no use in judging entries against one another.  That being said, I've opened my game and slapped together a Mk. 1-2 Command Pod, one Rockomax Jumbo-64 Fuel Tank, and a single RAPIER, which Mechjeb is happily telling me has a surface thrust-to-weight ratio of only 0.69, and this is Mechjeb giving me information about ideal conditions, not its actual thrust at sea level.  This specific 3-part vessel can't even leave the surface with a full tank.  If I give it only half a tank of fuel, it may be able to lift off, but without air intakes will only have enough delta-V to just barely reach LKO before it fizzles.  Interpreting the challenge more broadly, I add a shock-cone intake and give it a whirl-- a four-part vessel.

My test vessel finally achieves enough thrust to leave the launch pad only after it has burned down to roughly 550 units of fuel and 675ish units of oxidizer, and that's burning the rapier in its more powerful (from a standstill, anyway) closed-cycle mode.  This 4-part vessel has only 1,399 m/s of delta-V on board, calculating as if firing in a vacuum.  It cannot make it to the Mun, much less land there.
@igor290506 Please have a look at the linked guide to writing good challenges, and perhaps read a few of the more popular ones here. As written it is pretty vague and lacking in examples.

Three of us have now referenced the Challenge Submission Guide, with the last one to do so being a moderator.  You've still not modified the opening post to give us a clear idea even of what it is you're trying to get us to do, much less submitting any proof that what you desire is possible or providing a method for comparing different people's results in your challenge.  I'm washing my hands of this.  Good luck.

Please, please, stop filling the forum up with these badly made challenges. Would you actually try to read the submissions guide before you make another one?
